intro: Agrimonia eupatoria var. fallax, commonly known as autumn agrimony, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in dense clusters, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are oval with serrated edges and are covered in a fine downy layer. This variety is often found in dry meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
